level.text: In accordance with § 102(4) of the Act, D.C. Official Code § 3-1201.02(4), a dental hygienist may perform the following functions under the general supervision of a licensed dentist, in his or her office or any public school or institution rendering dental services:

A preliminary dental examination; a complete prophylaxis, including the removal of any deposits, diseased crevicular tissue, accretion, or stain from the surface of a tooth or a restoration; the polishing of a tooth or a restoration;
The charting of cavities during preliminary examination, prophylaxis, or polishing;
The application of a medicinal agent to a tooth for a prophylactic purpose and the application of therapeutic agents;
The taking of a dental X-ray;
The instruction of individuals or groups of individuals in oral health care;
The application of pit and fissure sealants; and
The performing of a screening to identify indications of oral abnormalities.

In addition to the functions listed in § 4310.1, a dental hygienist may perform the following functions under the direct supervision of a licensed dentist, as authorized by § 102(4)(A)(vi) of the Act, D.C. Official Code § 3-1201.2 (4)(A)(vi) (2001):
Monitoring of nitrous oxide;
Administration of local anesthesia with board identified criteria and authorization;
Administration of nitrous oxide with board identified criteria and authorization;
Placement of periodontal dressings;
Placement of temporary restorations;
Removal of temporary restorations;
Removal of periodontal dressings;
Removal of sutures;
Taking of study cast impressions;
Placement and removal of rubber dams; and
Bleaching.
A dental hygienist shall not perform the following functions:
Placement of sutures;
Application of cavity liners and bases;
Placement of amalgam restorations;
Carving amalgam restorations;
Finishing amalgam restorations;
Placement and finishing of composite resin/silicate restorations; and
Placement and removal of matrices; and
Any function that is defined as the practice of dentistry under the Act unless specifically authorized under this subchapter.
